name: NMC811 oxide production, for Li-ion battery | NMC811 oxide | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24710/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg nickel manganese cobalt (NMC) oxide, used as active material in the production NMC811 cathodes in Li-ion batteries. 

The activity starts when NMC811 hydroxide and other chemicals enter the process at the factory.

The activity ends with the production at factory gate of NMC811 oxide via calcination process.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2018 (year of the publication of data) and 2020 (year of the dataset)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The values in this dataset come from large-scale industrial production companies located in China and are assumed to be representative of the production of NMC111 oxide in China.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: NMC811 oxide is produced through a multi-step calcination process. NMC811 hydroxide and lithium hydroxide are mixed and heated in the calcination kiln over two or three rounds of mixing and calcination. The resulting material is crushed, sieved and demagnetized to obtain NMC811 oxide. The production process is completely automated and almost all electricity consumption is attributed to the calcination kiln. The facility can achieve an overall material efficiency of approximately100%.;;The general reaction is the following:;;NMC(OH)2 + 2LiOH --> Li-NMC-O2 + 2H2O.;Reference: ;;Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data about the production process of NMC811 oxide are retrieved from the literature (see published source field). The value of water emissions is calculated to obtain mass balance; the value of infrastructure is calculated as representative of the production site.

exchanges.description:
Literature. Original value 24.765 mmBTU/ton NMC811 oxide taken from the more up-to-date version of GREET2 model (Argonne National LAboratory, 2019, Available at: https://greet.es.anl.gov/ ) and Dai et al. (2018). Conversion factor: 1 mmBTU = 293.07135 kWh

Reference:
Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.
